episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the coincidental naming of the geographic center of North America, the invention of the modern door handle by philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein, the story of a celebrity ox in 1801 England, and a satirical newspaper published only on leap years.

facts.fact: My fact this week is that by complete coincidence, the centre of North America is called Centre.
OK, my fact this week is that the modern door handle was invented by Ludwig Wittgenstein.
My fact is that in 1801, England had a celebrity ox which had its own coach and horses.
And the fact is that the World's Least Frequently Published Newspaper is released once every four years on Leap Day.
